## Words of Warning

I use Typora & Sublime Text to write my posts.  
Typora's WYSIWYG mode usually processes `.Rmd` file correctly, but gets lost in a file as complicated as this one.  
When writing long posts in Sublime, minimap & [Ouline plugin](https://packagecontrol.io/packages/Outline) can be quite handy.  
Always check twice and preview the `.html` page.

When writing maths expressions, 

````markdown
Do this:
$\LaTeX$

Not this:
$ \LaTeX $
````

All codes will be displayed but not executed under default settings of this template. To turn on executing codes, type  

````markdown
`r ''````{r, eval = TRUE}
    (your code here)
```
````

for the chunk option.

## Plot

In order to refer to a figure, you must name the chunk that produces it, and turn on `eval`.   
See Figure \@ref(fig:pie) for example:

```{r pie, fig.cap="A fancy pie chart.", eval = TRUE}
par( mar = c( 0, 1, 0, 1 ))
pie(
  c( 280, 60, 20 ),
  c( 'Sky', 'Sunny side of pyramid', 'Shady side of pyramid' ),
  col = c( '#0292D8', '#F7EA39', '#C4B632' ),
  init.angle = -50, border = NA
)
```
